top-g.un:
HELP The form a is used before consonant sounds and the form an before vowel sounds. When saying abbreviations like 'FM' or 'UN', use a or an according to how the first letter is said. For example, F is a consonant, but begins with the sound /e/ and so you say: ◆ an FM radio
U is a vowel but begins with /j/ and so you say: ◆ a UN declaration
* a 用于辅音前，an 用于元音前。在 FM、UN 等缩略语前，用 a 还是用 an，需视首字母如何发音而定。如 F 是辅音字母，但其发音以 /e / 开头，故应说：an FM radio。U 是元音字母，但其发音以 /j / 开头，故应说：a UN declaration。

unbox.name: surprise
unbox.inlinelist: startle ◇ amaze ◇ stun ◇ astonish ◇ take sb aback ◇ astound

p.und: These words all mean to make sb feel surprised. 以上各词均含使惊奇、使诧异之义。

li.und: to give sb the feeling that you get when sth happens that you do not expect or do not understand, or sth that you do expect does not happen; to make sb feel surprised 指使惊奇、使诧异、使感到意外：

x-wr.x: The outcome didn't surprise me at all. 这一结果完全在我的意料之中。

li.und: to surprise sb suddenly in a way that slightly shocks or frightens them 指惊吓、使吓一跳、使大吃一惊：

x-wr.x: Sorry, I didn't mean to startle you. 对不起，我不是存心要吓唬你。
The explosion startled the horse. 爆炸声使马受了惊。

li.und: to surprise sb very much 指使惊奇、使惊愕、使惊诧：

x-wr.x: Just the huge size of the place amazed her. 仅仅地方之大就使她十分惊奇。

li.und: (rather informal ) (often in newspapers) to surprise or shock sb so much that they cannot think clearly or speak （常用于报章）指使震惊、使惊愕、使目瞪口呆
to surprise sb very much 指使十分惊讶、使大为惊奇：

x-wr.x: The news astonished everyone. 这消息使大家十分惊讶。

unbox.h3: amaze or astonish? 用 amaze 还是 astonish？

p.und: These two words have the same meaning and in most cases you can use either. If you are talking about sth that both surprises you and makes you feel ashamed, use astonish. 上述两词意思相同，多数情况下可通用。如果指某事既使人惊愕又使人羞愧则用 astonish：

x-wr.x: He was astonished by his own stupidity. 他对自己的愚蠢感到十分震惊。

li.und: [usually passive ] (especially of sth negative) to surprise or shock sb （尤指不好的事）使大吃一惊、使震惊：

x-wr.x: We were rather taken aback by her hostile reaction. 她敌视的反应使我们大吃一惊。

li.und: to surprise or shock sb very much 指使震惊、使大惊：

x-wr.x: His arrogance astounded her. 他的傲慢使她震惊。

li.und: It surprises sb/startles sb/amazes sb/stuns sb/astonishes sb/takes sb aback/astounds sb
to surprise/startle/amaze/stun/astonish/astound sb that…
to surprise/amaze sb what/how…
to surprise/startle/amaze/stun/astonish/astound sb to know/find/learn/see/hear…
to be surprised/startled/stunned into (doing) sth

unbox.name: can / could / be able to / manage

utitle.titled: can / could / be able to / manage

li.und: Can is used to say that somebody knows how to do something. * can 表示懂得做：

x-wr.x: Can you play the piano? 你会弹钢琴吗？

li.und: It is also used with verbs of seeing, noticing, etc. 该词亦与表示看见、注意到等的动词连用：

x-wr.x: I can hear someone calling. 我听见有人在呼叫。

li.und: and with passive infinitives. 并与不定式的被动形式连用：

x-wr.x: The podcast can be downloaded here. 播客可在此下载。

li.und: Can or be able to are used to say that something is possible or that somebody has the opportunity to do something. * can 或 be able to 表示某事情有可能或某人有机会做某事：

x-wr.x: Can you/are you able to come on Saturday? 你星期六能来吗？

li.und: You use be able to to form the future and perfect tenses and the infinitive. 用 be able to 构成将来时、完成时和动词不定式：

x-wr.x: You'll be able to get a taxi outside the station. 在车站外可搭乘出租车。
I haven't been able to get much work done today. 我今天未能干多少工作。
She'd love to be able to play the piano. 她很希望能弹钢琴。

li.und: Could is used to talk about what someone was generally able to do in the past. * could 表示过去通常能做：

x-wr.x: Our daughter could walk when she was nine months old. 我们的女儿九个月大就会走路了。

li.und: You use was/were able to or manage (but not could) when you are saying that something was possible on a particular occasion in the past. 关于在过去特定情况下可能的事用 was/were able to 或 manage，但不用 could：

x-wr.x: I was able to/managed to find some useful books in the library. 我总算在图书馆找到了一些有用的书。

x-g-blk.wx: I could find some useful books in the library.

li.und: In negative sentences, could not can also be used. 否定句也可用 could not：

x-wr.x: We weren't able to/didn't manage to/couldn't get there in time. 我们未能及时赶到那儿。

li.und: Could is also used with this meaning with verbs of seeing, noticing, understanding, etc. 亦可用 could 加表示看见、注意到、明白等的动词表示此义：

x-wr.x: I could see there was something wrong. 我发觉出事了。

li.und: Could have is used when you are saying that it was possible for somebody to do something in the past but they did not try. 表示过去有可能做某事但没有做，用 could have：

x-wr.x: I could have won the game but decided to let her win. 我本可以赢得那场比赛，但还是决定让她赢了。

这种病毒可能导致怀孕动物流产。

sn-g.def: to end or cause sth to end before it has been completed , especially because it is likely to fail （使）夭折，中止（尤指很可能失败的事情）

If the wrong password is given the program aborts .

计划在最后一刻取消了。

x.chn: 妇女做人工流产的权利

x.wd: I've always been anti-abortion.

x-wr.x:
I've always been anti -abortion .
我一直反对堕胎。

def.chn: 人工流产手术；堕胎手术

x.wd: She decided to have an abortion.

x-wr.x:
She decided to have an abortion .
她决定做人工流产。

sn-g.def: a person who performs abortions, especially illegally （尤指非法）为人堕胎者

sn-blk-nolist.sn-g:
(of an action 行动) not successful ; failed 不成功的；失败的 SYN unsuccessful ◆ an abortive military coup
一次流产的军事政变◆ abortive attempts to divert the course of the river
河流改道不遂的尝试

def.chn: 无限度事物；无休止的状况；无底洞

x.wd: There isn't a bottomless pit of money for public spending.

x-wr.x:
There isn't a bottomless pit of money for public spending .
公共开支并非用之不尽的。

vpform.a: present simple - I / you / we / they

x.wd: Stories about his travels abound.

x-wr.x:
Stories about his travels abound .
有关他游历的故事多得很。

x.wd: The lakes abound with fish.

x-wr.x:
The lakes abound with fish .
这些湖泊盛产鱼。

x.wd: The lakes abound with fish.

x-wr.x:
The lakes abound with fish .
这些湖泊盛产鱼。

sn-g.def: a little more or less than ; a little before or after 大约；左右

x.wd: It costs about $10.

x-wr.x:
It costs about $10 .
这大约要花 10 美元。

They waited (for ) about an hour .
他们等了一小时左右。

He arrived (at ) about ten .
他是十点钟左右到的。

sn-g.def: nearly ; very close to 将近；几乎

x.wd: I'm just about ready.

x-wr.x:
I'm just about ready .
我就要准备好了。

x.wd: This is about the best we can hope for.

x-wr.x:
This is about the best we can hope for .
这差不多是我们所能希望的最好结果。

sn-g.def: in many directions ; here and there 到处；处处；各处

x.wd: The children were rushing about in the garden.

x-wr.x:
The children were rushing about in the garden .
孩子们在花园里跑来跑去。

sn-g.def: in no particular order ; in various places 凌乱地；四处；到处

x.wd: Her books were lying about on the floor.

x-wr.x:
Her books were lying about on the floor .
她的书在地板上东一本西一本地放着。

x.wd: People were standing about in the road.

x-wr.x:
People were standing about in the road .
人们在路上闲站着。

x.wd: There was nobody about.

x-wr.x:
There was nobody about .
附近没有人。

x.wd: There's a lot of flu about.

x-wr.x:
There's a lot of flu about .
这一带流感肆虐。

x.wd: He brought the ship about.

x-wr.x:
He brought the ship about .
他掉转船头。

li.und: Around and round can often be used with the same meaning in BrE , though around is more formal. 在英式英语中，around 和 round 近义，不过 around 较正式：

x-wr.x: The earth goes round/around the sun. 地球绕着太阳转。
They live round/around the corner. 他们住在附近。
We travelled round/around India. 我们在印度各地旅行。
She turned round/around when I came in. 我进来时她转过身来。

li.und: In NAmE only around can be used in these meanings. 在美式英语中，表示上述意思只能用 around。
Around, round and about can also sometimes be used with the same meaning in BrE . 在英式英语中，有时 around、round 和 about 的含义相同：

x-wr.x: The kids were running around/round/about outside. 孩子们在外面跑来跑去。
I've been waiting around/round/about to see her all day. 为了要见到她，我等了一整天。

li.und: In NAmE only around can be used in these meanings. About or around can be used in both BrE and NAmE to mean 'approximately'. 在美式英语中，表示上述意思只能用 around。在英式英语和美式英语中，about 或 around 均可表示大约：

x-wr.x: We left around/about 8 o'clock. 我们在 8 点钟左右离开了。

def.chn: 我要说的就是这些；我的话完了

x.wd: 'Anything else?' 'No, that's about it for now.'

x-wr.x:
'Anything else ?' 'No , that's about it for now .'
“还有什么要说的吗？” “没有了，现在我要说的就是这些。”

sn-g.def: almost ; very nearly 几乎；近乎；差不多

x.wd: I've met just about everyone.

x-wr.x:
I've met just about everyone .
我几乎每个人都见到了。

x.wd: 'Did you reach your sales target?' 'Just about.'

x-wr.x:
'Did you reach your sales target ?' 'Just about .'
“你的销售目标达到了吗？” “差不多了。”

x.wd: She should be arriving just about now.

x-wr.x:
She should be arriving just about now .
她现在该到了。

x.wd: We've been out and about talking to people all over the country.

x-wr.x:
We've been out and about talking to people all over the country .
我们游遍了全国，和各地的人交谈。

sn-g.def: on the subject of sb /sth ; in connection with sb /sth 关于；对于

x.wd: Tell me all about it.

x-wr.x:
Tell me all about it .
把情况全部告诉我。

x.wd: What's she so angry about?

x-wr.x:
What's she so angry about ?
她为什么生这么大的气？

x.wd: There's something strange about him.

x-wr.x:
There's something strange about him .
他有点怪。

x.wd: I don't know what you're on about.

x-wr.x:
I don't know what you're on about (= talking about ).
我不懂你在谈什么。

x.wd: There's nothing you can do about it now.

x-wr.x:
There's nothing you can do about it now .
现在你对此毫无办法。

unbox.name: about
unbox.h2: Saying what a text is about 描述文章的内容

x-wr.x: The book is about homeless people in the cities. 这本书写的是城市中无家可归的人们。
The report deals with the issue of homelessness in London. 这篇报道是关于伦敦的无家可归问题。
The writer discusses the problems faced by homeless people. 作者讨论了无家可归者面临的种种问题。
The article presents an overview of the issues surrounding homelessness. 这篇文章概述了有关无家可归的种种问题。
The novel explores the theme of friendship among homeless people. 这部小说探究了无家可归者之间的友谊这个主题。
The first chapter examines the relationship between homelessness and drug addiction. 第一章考察了无家可归与吸毒成瘾之间的关系。
The paper considers the question of why so many young people become homeless. 这篇论文论述了为何如此多的年轻人变得无家可归的问题。

x.wd: Movies are all about making money these days.

x-wr.x:
Movies are all about making money these days .
当今电影只顾赚钱。

x.wd: What was all that about?
x.gl-blk: (= what was the reason for what has just happened ?)

sn-g.def: busy with sth ; doing sth 忙于；从事于

x.wd: Everywhere people were going about their daily business.

x-wr.x:
Everywhere people were going about their daily business .
无论哪里，人们都在忙着干日常工作。

x.chn: 在你干这件事的同时，顺便…

sn-g.def: in many directions in a place ; here and there 在…到处；在…各处

x.wd: We wandered about the town for an hour or so.

x-wr.x:
We wandered about the town for an hour or so .
我们在城里到处游逛了一个小时左右。

x.wd: He looked about the room.

x-wr.x:
He looked about the room .
他在房间里四下看了看。

sn-g.def: in various parts of a place ; here and there 在…四处

x.wd: The papers were strewn about the room.

x-wr.x:
The papers were strewn about the room .
房间里四处乱扔着文件。

sn-g.def: next to a place or person ; in the area mentioned 在…附近；在…地方

x.wd: She's somewhere about the office.

x-wr.x:
She's somewhere about the office .
她在办公室附近。

sn-g.def: surrounding sb /sth 围绕

x.wd: She wore a shawl about her shoulders.

x-wr.x:
She wore a shawl about her shoulders .
她披了一件披肩。

sn-g.def: used when asking for information about sb /sth （询问消息）怎么样，如何

x.wd: How about Ruth? Have you heard from her?

x-wr.x:
How about Ruth ? Have you heard from her ?
露丝怎么样了？你有她的消息吗？

x.wd: I'm having fish. What about you?

x-wr.x:
I'm having fish . What about you ?
我吃鱼，你呢？

x.wd: How about going for a walk?

x-wr.x:
How about going for a walk ?
去散散步怎么样？

x.wd: How about we go for a walk?

x-wr.x:
How about we go for a walk ?
我们去散散步怎么样？

x.wd: What about a break?

x-wr.x:
What about a break ?
休息一下如何？

sn-g.def: to be close to doing sth ; to be going to do sth very soon 即将，行将，正要（做某事）

x.wd: I was just about to ask you the same thing.

x-wr.x:
I was just about to ask you the same thing .
我刚才正要问你同一件事情。

sn-g.def: to not be willing to do sth ; to not intend to do sth 不愿，无意（做某事）

x.wd: I've never done any cooking and I'm not about to start now.

x-wr.x:
I've never done any cooking and I'm not about to start now .
我从来没有做过饭，也不想从现在开始做起来。

sn-g.def: if you have or carry sth about /on your person , you carry it about with you , for example in your pocket 随身带着；身上有
a complete change of opinion , plan or behaviour （意见、计划、行为的）彻底改变

x.wd: The government did an about-turn over nuclear energy.

x-wr.x:
The government did an about -turn over nuclear energy .
政府对核能的态度来了个 180 度的大转变。

sn-g.def: at or to a higher place or position than sth /sb 在（或向）…上面

x.wd: The water came above our knees.

x-wr.x:
The water came above our knees .
水淹过了我们的膝盖。

x.wd: We were flying above the clouds.

x-wr.x:
We were flying above the clouds .
我们在云层上面飞行。

x.chn: 我楼上那套公寓里的人们

x.wd: A captain in the navy ranks above a captain in the army.

x-wr.x:
A captain in the navy ranks above a captain in the army .
海军的 captain（上校）军衔比陆军的 captain（上尉）高。

x.wd: They finished the year six places above their local rivals.

x-wr.x:
They finished the year six places above their local rivals .
这一年结束，他们的排名比当地竞争对手超前六个名次。

sn-g.def: more than sth ; greater in number , level or age than sb /sth （数目、数量、水平、年龄）超过，多于，大于

x.wd: Inflation is above 6%.

x-wr.x:
Inflation is above 6% .
通货膨胀超过 6%。

x.wd: Temperatures have been above average.

x-wr.x:
Temperatures have been above average .
气温一直比平均温度高。

x.wd: We cannot accept children above the age of 10.

x-wr.x:
We cannot accept children above the age of 10 .
我们不能接受 10 岁以上的儿童。

li.und: Above and over can both be used to describe a position higher than something. * above 和 over 均可表示位置高于…或在…上：

x-wr.x: They built a new room above/over the garage. 他们在车库上面加建了一个房间。

li.und: When you are talking about movement from one side of something to the other, you can only use over. 表示从某物的一边移至另一边只能用 over：

x-wr.x: They jumped over the stream. 他们跳过了小溪。

li.und: Over can also mean 'covering'. * over 亦可表示覆盖着：

x-wr.x: He put a blanket over the sleeping child. 他把毯子盖在睡着了的孩子身上。

li.und: Above and over can also mean 'more than'. Above is used in relation to a minimum level or a fixed point. * above 和 over 亦可表示多于。above 与最低限度或某固定值关联：

x-wr.x: 2 000 feet above sea level 海拔 2 000 英尺
Temperatures will not rise above zero tonight. 今天夜间的温度不会高于零度。

li.und: Over is used with numbers, ages, money and time. * over 与数目、年龄、金钱和时间连用：

x-wr.x: He's over 50. 他已年过半百。
It costs over £100. 这个花了 100 多英镑。
We waited over 2 hours. 我们等了两个多小时。

sn-g.def: of greater importance or of higher quality than sb /sth （重要性、质量）超过，胜过

x.wd: I rate her above most other players of her age.

x-wr.x:
I rate her above most other players of her age .
我认为她优于大多数同龄参赛者。

def.chn: （因善良或诚实正直而）不至于，不屑于（做某事）

x.wd: She's not above lying when it suits her.

x-wr.x:
She's not above lying when it suits her .
她在适当时机还是会说谎的。

x.wd: He's above suspicion.

x-wr.x:
He's above suspicion (= he is completely trusted ).
他无可置疑。

licontent.sn-g:
(of a sound 声音) louder or clearer than another sound （音量或清晰度）超过（另一种声音）◆ I couldn't hear her above the noise of the traffic .
交通嘈杂，我听不见她的声音。🔊🔊

sn-g.def: most important of all ; especially 最重要的是；尤其是

x.wd: Above all, keep in touch.

x-wr.x:
Above all , keep in touch .
最要紧的是保持联系。

unbox.name: emphasis
unbox.h2: Highlighting an important point 强调重点

x-wr.x: This case emphasizes / highlights the importance of honest communication between managers and employees. 这个事例凸显出经理与员工之间坦诚交流的重要性。
Effective communication skills are essential / crucial / vital. 有效的交流技巧是至关重要的。
It should be noted that this study considers only verbal communication. Non-verbal communication is not dealt with here. 应该注意的是本研究只考查了言语交流，在此没有涉及非言语交流。
It is important to remember that / An important point to remember is that non-verbal communication plays a key role in getting your message across. 非言语交流在传递信息过程中起着重要的作用，记住这一点非常重要。

x-gs.x-g-blk: ◆eideid="emphasis_x_13" e_id="13cbabd5a4a.-6c86" e_inline="y" tranID="6" status="6">Communication is not only about the words you use but also your body language and, especially / above all, the effectiveness with which you listen. 交流不仅涉及使用的词语，同时也涉及身体语言，尤其与能否有效听取对方的话有关。

x-wr.x: I would like to draw attention to the role of listening in effective communication. 我想让大家注意倾听在有效交流中扮演的角色。
Choose your words carefully: in particular, avoid confusing and ambiguous language. 注意用词，特别是避免使用令人费解和有歧义的语言。
Finally, and perhaps most importantly, you must learn to listen as well as to speak. 最后，也许是最重要的，你不仅要学会说还要学会听。

x.wd: There are other factors over and above those we have discussed.

x-wr.x:
There are other factors over and above those we have discussed .
除了我们所讨论的之外，还有其他因素。

def.chn: 在（或向）上面；在（或向）较高处

x.wd: Put it on the shelf above.

x-wr.x:
Put it on the shelf above .
把它放到上面的搁板上。

x.wd: Seen from above the cars looked tiny.

x-wr.x:
Seen from above the cars looked tiny .
从高处往下看，车辆显得很小。

x.wd: They were acting on instructions from above.

x-wr.x:
They were acting on instructions from above (= from sb in a higher position of authority ).
他们是在按照上级的指示办事。

sn-g.def: greater in number , level or age （数目、数量、水平、年龄）超过，更多，更大

x.wd: A score of 70 or above will get you an 'A'.

x-wr.x:
A score of 70 or above will get you an 'A' .
70 分或以上就可以得 “优”。

x.chn: 12 岁及 12 岁以上的孩子

x.wd: See above, page 97.

x-wr.x:
See above , page 97 .
见前文，第 97 页。

sn-g.def: mentioned or printed previously in a letter , book , etc . 前文述及的；上述的

x.wd: Please write to us at the above address.

x-wr.x:
Please write to us at the above address .
请按上述地址来函。

x.wd: Please notify us if the above is not correct.

x-wr.x:
Please notify us if the above is not correct .
如果上面所说的不正确，请通知我们。

x.wd: All the above have passed the exam.

x-wr.x:
All the above (= people mentioned above ) have passed the exam .
以上各人都通过了考试。

sn-g.def: most important of all ; especially 最重要的是；尤其是

x.wd: Above all, keep in touch.

x-wr.x:
Above all , keep in touch .
最要紧的是保持联系。

unbox.name: emphasis
unbox.h2: Highlighting an important point 强调重点

x-wr.x: This case emphasizes / highlights the importance of honest communication between managers and employees. 这个事例凸显出经理与员工之间坦诚交流的重要性。
Effective communication skills are essential / crucial / vital. 有效的交流技巧是至关重要的。
It should be noted that this study considers only verbal communication. Non-verbal communication is not dealt with here. 应该注意的是本研究只考查了言语交流，在此没有涉及非言语交流。
It is important to remember that / An important point to remember is that non-verbal communication plays a key role in getting your message across. 非言语交流在传递信息过程中起着重要的作用，记住这一点非常重要。
Communication is not only about the words you use but also your body language and, especially / above all, the effectiveness with which you listen. 交流不仅涉及使用的词语，同时也涉及身体语言，尤其与能否有效听取对方的话有关。
I would like to draw attention to the role of listening in effective communication. 我想让大家注意倾听在有效交流中扮演的角色。
Choose your words carefully: in particular, avoid confusing and ambiguous language. 注意用词，特别是避免使用令人费解和有歧义的语言。
Finally, and perhaps most importantly, you must learn to listen as well as to speak. 最后，也许是最重要的，你不仅要学会说还要学会听。

sn-g.def: in /not in a position where you see it first , for example in the top /bottom part of a newspaper page or web page （报纸或网页）最上／下面部分，最显眼／不显眼部分

x.wd: Your ad will be placed above the fold for prominent exposure.

x-wr.x:
Your ad will be placed above the fold for prominent exposure .
你们的广告将放在页面上端的醒目位置。

sn-g.def: too good , honest , etc . to have done sth wrong , illegal or dishonest 无可置疑

x.wd: Nobody who was near the scene of the crime is above suspicion.

x-wr.x:
Nobody who was near the scene of the crime is above suspicion .
犯罪现场附近的任何人都不能排除嫌疑。

x.wd: Don't worry; the deal was completely above board.

Don't worry ; the deal was completely above board .
别担心，交易是完全合法的。

sn-g.un: ORIGIN If card players keep their hands above the table (the board ), other players can see what they are doing . 源于纸牌游戏。如果玩牌者将手放在桌上，其动作就会被其他玩牌者看得一清二楚。

sn-g.def: mentioned or named earlier in the same letter , book , etc . 前文述及的；上述的
in a position where it is seen first , for example on the top half of the front page of a newspaper or in the part of a web page that you see first when you open it （报纸头版、网页等）居于上端的，位置明显的，第一眼看到的

x-wr.x:
above -the -fold images
位置醒目的图像

The company logo must be placed in an above -the -fold position .
公司标志必须放在显眼的位置。

sn-g.def: in /not in a position where you see it first , for example in the top /bottom part of a newspaper page or web page （报纸或网页）最上／下面部分，最显眼／不显眼部分

x.wd: Your ad will be placed above the fold for prominent exposure.

x-wr.x:
Your ad will be placed above the fold for prominent exposure .
你们的广告将放在页面上端的醒目位置。

sn-g.def: to rub the surface of sth , such as rock or skin , and damage it or make it rough 磨损（岩石等）；擦伤（皮肤等）

def.chn: （皮肤、表皮）擦伤处；（表层）磨损处

x.wd: He suffered cuts and abrasions to the face.

p.und: These words all describe sb/sth that attracts or holds your attention because they are exciting, unusual or full of good ideas. 以上各词均形容人或事物有吸引力、有趣味。

li.und: attracting your attention because it is exciting, unusual or full of good ideas 指有趣的、有吸引力的：

x-wr.x: That's an interesting question, Daniel. 那是个有趣的问题，丹尼尔。

li.und: extremely interesting or attractive 指极有吸引力的、迷人的：

x-wr.x: The exhibition tells the fascinating story of the steam age. 展览讲述了蒸汽时代引人入胜的故事。

li.und: (rather formal ) so interesting or exciting that it holds your attention 指引人入胜的、扣人心弦的：

x-wr.x: Her latest book makes compelling reading. 她新出的书读起来扣人心弦。

li.und: full of interesting or exciting ideas; making people feel enthusiastic 指趣味盎然的、激励人的、振奋人心的：

x-wr.x: Thank you for a most stimulating discussion. 感谢你们妙趣横生的讨论。

li.und: so exciting or interesting that it holds your attention completely 指激动人心的、吸引人的、扣人心弦的：

x-wr.x: His books are always so gripping. 他的书总是那么扣人心弦。

li.und: so interesting or enjoyable that it holds your attention 指十分吸引人的、引人入胜的、精彩的：

x-wr.x: Chess can be an extremely absorbing game. 国际象棋有时就是一场引人入胜的游戏。

a(n) interesting/fascinating/stimulating experience/discussion/idea

unbox.name: agree
unbox.inlinelist: accept ◇ approve ◇ go along with sb/sth ◇ consent

p.und: These words all mean to say that you will do what sb wants or that you will allow sth to happen. 以上各词均含答应、同意之义。

li.und: to say that you will do what sb wants or that you will allow sth to happen 指答应、容许：

x-wr.x: He agreed to let me go early. 他容许我早走。

li.und: to be satisfied with sth that has been done, decided or suggested 指同意、接受、认可：

x-wr.x: They accepted the court's decision. 他们接受法院的判决。

li.und: to officially agree to a plan, suggestion or request 指批准、正式通过（计划、建议或要求）：

x-wr.x: The committee unanimously approved the plan. 委员会一致通过了计划。

li.und: (rather informal ) to agree to sth that sb else has decided; to agree with sb else's ideas 指赞同某事，同意某人的观点：

x-wr.x: She just goes along with everything he suggests. 他的一切建议她都赞同。

li.und: (rather formal ) to agree to sth or give your permission for sth 指同意、准许、允许：

x-wr.x: She finally consented to answer our questions. 她最终同意回答我们的问题。

li.und: to agree/consent to sth
to agree/consent to do sth
to agree to/accept/approve/go along with/consent to a plan/proposal
to agree to/accept/approve a request

unbox.name: luck

p.und: These are all words for things that happen or the force that causes them to happen. 以上各词均指机遇、命运、运气。

li.und: the force that causes good or bad things to happen to people 指机遇、命运、运气：

x-wr.x: This ring has always brought me good luck. 这戒指总是给我带来好运。

li.und: the way that some things happen without any cause that you can see or understand 指偶然、碰巧、意外：

x-wr.x: The results could simply be due to chance. 这结果可能纯属意外。

li.und: the fact of two things happening at the same time by chance, in a surprising way 指出人意料的巧合、巧事：

x-wr.x: They met through a series of strange coincidences. 他们因一连串奇妙的巧合而相遇。

li.und: something that happens unexpectedly and is not planned in advance 指意外、偶然的事：

x-wr.x: Their early arrival was just an accident. 他们早到仅仅是偶然而已。

li.und: the power that is believed to control everything that happens and that cannot be stopped or changed 指命运、天数、定数、天意：

x-wr.x: Fate decreed that she would never reach America. 命中注定她永远到不了美国。

li.und: the power that is believed to control events 指主宰事物的力量、命运之神：

x-wr.x: I believe there's some force guiding us—call it God, destiny or fate. 我认为有某种力量在指引着我们，称之为上帝也罢，天意也罢，或是命运也罢。

unbox.h3: fate or destiny? 用 fate 还是 destiny？

li.und: Fate can be kind, but this is an unexpected gift; just as often, fate is cruel and makes people feel helpless. Destiny is more likely to give people a sense of power: people who have a strong sense of destiny usually believe that they are meant to be great or do great things. * fate 有时是善意的，但那只是意外的恩赐；fate 也是残酷的，使人感到无能为力；destiny 更可能给人力量的感觉，have a strong sense of destiny 指人具有强烈使命感，通常认为自己必将不同凡响或成就伟业。
by …luck/chance/coincidence/accident
It's no coincidence/accident that…
pure/sheer luck/chance/coincidence/accident
to believe in luck/coincidences/fate/destiny

unbox.name: according to
unbox.h2: Reporting someone's opinion 陈述某人的观点

x-wr.x: Photography is, according to Vidal, the art form of untalented people. 据维达尔所言，摄影是没有天赋的人的艺术形式。
For Vidal, photography is the art form of untalented people. 对维达尔来说，摄影是没有天赋的人的艺术形式。
His view is that photography is not art but merely the mechanical reproduction of images. 他的观点是摄影不是艺术，而只是机械地复制图像。
Smith takes the view that photography is both an art and a science. 史密斯所持的观点是：摄影既是一门艺术也是一门科学。
In Brown's view, photography should be treated as a legitimate art in its own right. 在布朗看来，摄影本身就应该被视为一种正当的艺术。
James is of the opinion that a good painter can always be a good photographer if he or she so decides. 詹姆斯认为一个好的画家定能成为一个好的摄影师，只要他／她一心这样做。
Emerson believed that a photograph should only reflect what the human eye can see. 埃默森认为照片应该只是反映人们肉眼所能见到的东西。

unbox.name: illustrate
unbox.h2: Referring to a chart, graph or table 描述图或表

x-wr.x: This bar chart illustrates how many journeys people made on public transport over a three-month period. 这个柱状图显示三个月期间人们乘坐公共交通往来的次数。
This table compares bus, train, and taxi use between April and June. 这个表比较了四月至六月公交车、火车和出租车的使用情况。
The results are shown in the chart below. 结果显示在下面的图表中。
In this pie chart, the survey results are broken down by age. 在这个饼分图中，调查结果按年龄划分。
This pie chart breaks down the survey results by age. 这个饼分图按年龄对调查结果进行分类。
As can be seen from these results, younger people use buses more than older people. 从结果可以看出，年轻人比老年人乘坐公交车的频率更高。
According to these figures, bus travel accounts for 60% of public transport use. 从这些数字看，乘坐公交车出行占公共交通使用率的 60%。
From the data in the above graph, it is apparent that buses are the most widely used form of public transport. 从上图的数据明显看出：公交车是公共交通中使用最广泛的类型。

unbox.name: bill

p.und: These are all words for a record of how much you owe for goods or services you have bought or used. 以上各词均指账单、账目。

li.und: a list of goods that you have bought or services that you have used, showing how much you owe; the price or cost of sth 指账单：

x-wr.x: the gas bill 煤气费账单

li.und: an arrangement with a shop/store or business to pay bills for goods or services at a later time, for example in regular amounts every month 指赊销账、赊欠账、赊购：

x-wr.x: Put it on my account please. 请记在我的赊购账上。

li.und: (rather formal ) a bill for goods that sb has bought or work that has been done for sb 指发票、发货或服务费用清单：

x-wr.x: The builders sent an invoice for £250. 营造商发出了一张 250 英镑的发票。

unbox.h3: bill or invoice? 用 bill 还是 invoice？

p.und: You would get a bill in a restaurant, bar or hotel; from a company that supplies you with gas, electricity, etc.; or from sb whose property you have damaged. An invoice is for goods supplied or work done as agreed between a customer and supplier. * bill 指餐馆、酒吧、旅馆、煤气公司、电力公司等开出的账单或财产所有者开出的索赔清单。invoice 指客户与供应商约定的供货或服务费用清单。

li.und: (NAmE ) a piece of paper that shows how much you have to pay for the food and drinks that you have had in a restaurant 指餐馆的账单：

x-wr.x: Can I have the check, please? 请给我结账。

un.und: In British English the usual word for this is bill. 此义英式英语中常用 bill。

li.und: the bill/invoice/check for sth
to pay/settle a(n) bill/account/invoice/check
to put sth on the/sb's bill/account/invoice/check

这家代理机构失去了几家最重要的老客户。

sn-g.def: an arrangement that sb has with a company that allows them to use the Internet , send and receive messages by email , etc . （互联网、电子邮件等的）账户，账号

x.wd: She gave the police a full account of the incident.

x-wr.x:
She gave the police a full account of the incident .
她向警方详尽地叙述了所发生的事情。

unbox.name: report

p.und: These are all words for a written or spoken account of events. 以上各词均指对所发生事情的记述、讲述。

li.und: a written or spoken account of an event, especially one that is published or broadcast 尤指刊登或广播的报道：

x-wr.x: Are these newspaper reports true? 报纸上这些报道属实吗？

li.und: an account, often spoken, of what happened to sb or of how sth happened; a report of events in a newspaper, magazine or news broadcast 常指对所发生事情的口头叙述、描述、（新闻）报道：

x-wr.x: It was many years before the full story was made public. 许多年之后，事情的全貌才公之于众。
the front-page story 头版报道

li.und: a written or spoken description of sth that has happened 指对所发生事情的书面或口头描述、叙述、报告：

x-wr.x: She gave the police a full account of the incident. 她向警方详尽地叙述了所发生的事情。

unbox.h3: report or account? 用 report 还是 account？

p.und: A report is always of recent events, especially news. An account may be of recent or past events. * report 总是指对最新事情的报道，尤指新闻报道。account 可指对最近的或过去的事情的叙述。

li.und: a description of an event from the point of view of a particular person or group of people 指特定的人或群体对某事的描述、说法：

x-wr.x: She gave us her version of what had happened that day. 她从她的角度向我们描述了那天发生的事情。

li.und: a report/story about sth
a brief/short report/story/account
a full report/story/account/version
a news report/story
to give a(n) report/account/version

sn-g.def: an explanation or a description of an idea , a theory or a process （对思想、理论、过程的）解释，说明，叙述

x.wd: I've never been there, but it's a lovely place, by all accounts.

x-wr.x:
I've never been there , but it's a lovely place , by all accounts .
我从未去过那里，但据说是个美丽的地方。

x.wd: By his own account he had an unhappy childhood.

x-wr.x:
By his own account he had an unhappy childhood .
据他自己说，他童年不快乐。

idm-blk.idm: give a good /poor acˈcount of yourself

sn-g.def: to do sth or perform well or badly , especially in a contest （尤指比赛中）表现好／不好，干得出色／差劲

x.wd: The team gave a good account of themselves in the match.

x-wr.x:
The team gave a good account of themselves in the match .
这个队在比赛中表现出色。

sn-g.def: if you buy sth or pay on account , you pay nothing or only a small amount immediately and the rest later 挂账；（先付小部分款额的）赊账

x.wd: Please don't change your plans on my account.

x-wr.x:
Please don't change your plans on my account .
请别因为我而改变你的计划。

sn-g.def: because of sb /sth 由于；因为

x.wd: She retired early on account of ill health.

x-wr.x:
She retired early on account of ill health .
她体弱多病，所以提前退休。
The number of people with diabetes is growing, partly because of an increase in levels of obesity. 患糖尿病的人数不断上升，部分原因是肥胖人数增加。
The number of overweight children has increased dramatically in recent years, largely as a result of changes in diet and lifestyle. 近年来肥胖儿童的数量急剧上升，很大程度上是由饮食和生活方式的改变引起的。
The increase in childhood obesity is largely due to / the result of changes in lifestyle and diet over the last twenty years. 肥胖儿童人数的增多主要是过去二十年来饮食和生活方式的改变所致。
Many obese children are bullied at school on account of their weight. 许多肥胖儿童因为其体重问题在学校受到欺负。
Part of the problem with treating childhood obesity stems from the fact that parents do not always recognize that their children are obese. 治疗肥胖儿童的困难部分源自父母有时并不认为自己的孩子肥胖。
Childhood obesity may be caused by genetic factors, as well as environmental ones. 儿童肥胖既可能由环境因素引起，也可能是遗传因素所致。

sn-g.use-blk: (used to emphasize sth 用于强调)

x.wd: On no account should the house be left unlocked.

x-wr.x:
On no account should the house be left unlocked .
离开住宅时千万要锁门。

In 2012 Smith set up in business on his own account .
2012 年史密斯开始创业。

sn-g.def: because you want to and you have decided , not sb else 自愿地

x-wr.x:
No one sent me . I am here on my own account .
没有人派我，我自己来的。

天气不好，但他并没有因此延期启程。

sn-g.def: to consider particular facts , circumstances , etc . when making a decision about sth 考虑到；顾及

x-wr.x:

The largest proportion of time is spent playing computer games. 大部分时间都花在玩电脑游戏上。

x.wd: I seem to have accumulated a lot of books.

x-wr.x:
I seem to have accumulated a lot of books .
我好像已经收集了很多书。

x.wd: By investing wisely she accumulated a fortune.

x-wr.x:
By investing wisely she accumulated a fortune .
她投资精明，积累了一笔财富。

unbox.name: collect

p.und: These words all mean to get more of sth over a period of time, or to increase in quantity over a period of time. 以上各词均含收集、聚积、积累之义。

li.und: to bring things or information together from different people or places; to gradually increase in amount in a place 指收集、采集、聚积、积累：

x-wr.x: We've been collecting data from various sources. 我们一直从各种渠道收集资料。
Dirt had collected in the corners of the room. 房间的角落里积满了灰尘。

un.und: People sometimes collect things of a particular type as a hobby. 作为爱好收藏物品用 collect：

x-wr.x: to collect stamps 集邮

li.und: to bring things together that have been spread around; to collect information from different sources 指收拢、归拢（分散的东西），搜集、收集（情报）：

x-wr.x: I waited while he gathered up his papers. 他整理文件时我就在一旁等待。
Detectives have spent months gathering evidence. 侦探花了数月时间搜集证据。

unbox.h3: collect or gather? 用 collect 还是 gather？

p.und: Both collect and gather can be used in the same way to talk about bringing together data, information or evidence. When talking about things, gather is used with words like things, belongings or papers when the things are spread around within a short distance. Collect is used for getting examples of sth from different people or places that are physically separated. * collect 和 gather 均可指收集资料、情报或证据。将分散在附近的东西、财物或文件收拢用 gather；从不同的人或分散的地方收集样品用 collect。

li.und: (rather formal ) to gradually get more and more of sth over a period of time; to gradually increase in number or quantity over a period of time 指积累、聚积，（数量）逐渐增加：

x-wr.x: I seem to have accumulated a lot of books. 我好像已经积存了很多书。
Debts began to accumulate. 债务开始增加。

li.und: (rather formal ) to collect sth in large quantities, especially money, debts or information 指大量积累、积聚（尤指金钱、债务或情报）：

x-wr.x: He amassed a fortune from silver mining. 他靠开采银矿积累了一笔财富。

li.und: to collect/gather/accumulate/amass data/evidence/information
to accumulate/amass a fortune/debts
dirt/dust/debris collects/accumulates
to gradually/slowly collect/gather/accumulate (sth)

def.chn: （数量）逐渐增加；（数额）逐渐增长
